page.title: 02RIVER THAMES, KINGSTON
page.content: On the{River Thames}there are many kinds of boats, such as motor cruisers, speed boats, rowing and sailing boats. There are also pleasure boats that take people to {Hampton Court, Windsor}and{Richmond,} two of these are paddle steamers. Schools use the river to learn to row or sail on. There are two ferry stations where people can cross to{ {Hampton Court Park.} On the Kingston side there are some gardens, called{ {Queens Promenade}and on the Hampton Court side there are four private houses. The wildlife to be found on the river are fish, ducks, Canadian Geese and some swans. People feed the pigeons and other wildlife while they sit on benches in the sun.
